p:
As we reported in our initial study on 1,
15 a
the addition of TFEOH under O 2 saturation conditions causes a catalytic increase in current ( Fig. 3A, red). Upon the addition of 0.5 mM BQ to a solution of 1 (1 : 1 ratio of 1 : BQ) and TFEOH (1.37 M) under O 2 saturation conditions, a shift towards more positive potentials and a multielectron irreversible wave consistent with catalysis is observed ( Fig. 3B, blue). Comparative electrochemical reaction conditions where Mn(
tbu dhbpy)Cl 1, O 2, TFEOH, or BQ are omitted do not show analogous activity, indicating that an alternate electrochemical process is occurring when all four components are present. Importantly, these observations are consistent when greater concentrations of BQ (1.25 mM or 2.5 mM) are present (Fig. S20 and S21 †).
